com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.csrf

Class DefaultCsrfTokenManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stormpath.sdk.servlet.csrf.DefaultCsrfTokenManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CsrfTokenManager

    public class DefaultCsrfTokenManager
extends Object
implements CsrfTokenManager
    Default implementation of the CsrfTokenManager interface. To ensure correct behavior, the specified TTL MUST be the equal to or greater than the specified nonce cache's TTL.
    Since:
    1.0.RC3

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultCsrfTokenManager

        public DefaultCsrfTokenManager(String tokenName,
                               Cache<String,String> nonceCache,
                               String signingKey,
                               long ttlMillis)
        Instantiates a new DefaultCacheManager.
        Parameters:
        tokenName - The name that will be used to identify the CSRF token. This name is used to obtain the token from the forms for example.
        nonceCache - a cache to place used CSRF tokens. This is required to ensure the consumed token is never used again, which is mandatory for CSRF protection. This cache MUST have a TTL value equal to or greater than ttlMillis. Cache key: a unique token ID, Cache value: the used token
        signingKey - a (hopefully secure-random) cryptographic signing key used to digitally sign the CSRF token to ensure it cannot be tampered with by HTTP clients.
        ttlMillis - the length of time in milliseconds for which a generated CSRF token is valid. When a token is created, it cannot be used after this duration, even if it has not been consumed yet.

    • Method Detail

      • getTokenName

        public String getTokenName()
        Description copied from interface: CsrfTokenManager
        The name of CSRF token. This name is used to obtain the token from requests and forms for example.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the name of the CSRF that will be used in form field for example.

      • createCsrfToken

        public String createCsrfToken(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Description copied from interface: CsrfTokenManager
        Returns a new 1-time-use CSRF token. For an HTML form, every time the form is rendered, a new CSRF token should be embedded in the form as a hidden field.
        Specified by:
        createCsrfToken in interface CsrfTokenManager
        Parameters:
        request - the incoming request.
        response - the outbound response.
        Returns:
        a new 1-time-use CSRF token.

      • getClient

        protected Client getClient(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)

      • isValidCsrfToken

        public boolean isValidCsrfToken(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                String csrfToken)
        Description copied from interface: CsrfTokenManager
        Returns true if the specified token is valid and the request (e.g. form post) should be allowed to be processed, or false if the token is not valid and request processing should be disallowed. In either case, the token is consumed and may not be used again (this method is not idempotent).

        Forms

        Every time a form is submitted, the token (presumably submitted in a hidden form field) must be checked for validity with this method. If the token is valid, form processing is allowed. If the token is not valid, the form post should be rejected. In either case, if showing the form again, a new token must be generated and embedded in the form as a hidden form field to ensure it is submitted on the next form post.

        Specified by:
        isValidCsrfToken in interface CsrfTokenManager
        Parameters:
        request - inbound request
        response - outbound response
        csrfToken - the CSRF token discovered during the request. Can be null.
        Returns:
        true if the specified token is valid and the request (e.g. form post) should be allowed to be processed, or false if the token is not valid and request processing should be disallowed.
